DOC.HEAD: Khmer Rouge Claim Major Victory in northern Cambodia
DOC.TEXT: Khmer Rouge guerrillas Friday claimed to have captured the third district capital since Vietnam's troop withdrawal from Cambodia three months ago, according to the guerrilla radio. The Voice of the National Army of Democratic Kampuchea said the guerrillas had been besieging the area around the town of Anlung Veng since mid-November. ``On the 19th and 20th of December, our Cambodian national resistance forces launched an offensive to destroy and completely liberate the strategic Anlung Veng position,'' said a transcript of the radio report seen in Bangkok. If true, the seizure of Anlung Veng would one of the most important Khmer Rouge victories since their seizure of the western town and district capital of Pailin Oct. 22. The Khmer Rouge also say they have taken the district seat of Samlot. The radio said Anlung Veng had protected the entire government defense network along the Dangrek mountain range, which marks the border between Cambodia and Thailand. ``The attack and liberation of this position ... has basically dismantled the networks defending the positions of the Vietnamese enemies and their puppets along the Dangrek mountain range,'' it said. The guerrillas also claimed they had ``attacked and swept'' other positions along route 69 and to the south and east of Anlung Veng. The Communist Khmer Rouge is the strongest of the guerrilla factions fighting the government Vietnam installed in Phnom Penh after its late-1978 invasion. The invasion ended a 3{-year reign of terror by the Khmer Rouge in which hundreds of thousands of Cambodians were killed. Since Hanoi's avowed late-September troop withdrawal, the guerrillas have launched big attacks and seized several towns in the northwestern part of the country. The Khmer Rouge maintain that Hanoi's withdrawal was a trick and that tens of thousands of disguised Vietnamese soliders remain in the country. The radio report said the area around Anlung Veng was defended by the Vietnamese 302nd division and government soldiers from the 4th military region.
